title: Art Deco Revisited
content:

Seen on Google night project \> [https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/campaigns/google-night-walk.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/https:/www.thinkwithgoogle.com/campaigns/google-night-walk.html "https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/campaigns/google-night-walk.html")

 http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/

author: ESIETE

comments.content:
Thought these monoline Art Deco letters might have been a Google font, but I drew a blank there.  
A poor substitute: Plaza Ultra

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PlazaUltraAsSGWREHNMAK_4078.gif)
  [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/plaza-lt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/plaza-lt/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/plaza-lt/")  
Hand lettered?  
Don
I'm trying to find it for a new identity. Like a basis to redraw some characters...

I am not clear as to whether you are looking for a rough or smooth base font to uses as a basis for redrawing.  
For a rough font consider Chancellor

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ChancellorAsSGWREHNMAK_5624.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/")  
Also Berliner Grotesk BQ Med 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BerlinerGroteskBQMedAsSGWREHNMAK_6301.gif)
  
 [http://www.linotype.com/261314/BerlinerGrotesk-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/http:/www.linotype.com/261314/BerlinerGrotesk-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/261314/BerlinerGrotesk-family.html")  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/volume?SiteId=15](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/http:/www.fonts.com/font/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/volume?SiteId=15 "http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/volume?SiteId=15")  
would work.  
EDITED ADDITIONAL INFO:  
This style of lettering seems have originated with Lucian Bernhard's Sachplakat --object poster or Plakatsil -- lettering. From about 1908 onwards versions were produced by German type makers such as Heinz Hoffmann, who designed the Block fonts 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BlockBQAsSGWREHNMAK_6507.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/block-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/block-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/block-bq/")  
Don

It appears to be Chancellor, by Pintassilgo Prints (the |K| appears to have been customized):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/chancellor/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Chancellor_6095.png)

I rechecked my previous post.  
If you mix upper and lower case in Chancellor you can get this

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317094949im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ChancellorAsSgwa_3878.jpg)
 which means that little if any editing is needed to match the letters in \_NIGHT WALK IN MARSEILLE\_.  
Don
